meanings.definition: The quality of being able to be addressed or targeted.
meanings.sent1: The addressability of the website made it easy for users to find information.
meanings.sent2: The addressability of the mail system allowed for efficient delivery of packages.
meanings.sent3: The addressability of the lost cat poster led to a funny mix-up with a neighbor's pet.
meanings.sent4: Her addressability in the game was like a homing beacon, always finding the target.
meanings.sent5: The addressability of the GPS was so precise that it could pinpoint the exact location of the treasure.

meanings.definition: The ability to access or refer to a specific location or item.
meanings.sent1: The addressability of the map app helped us navigate through the city.
meanings.sent2: The addressability of the library catalog made it easy to find books.
meanings.sent3: The addressability of the key to the secret room was a fun mystery for the kids to solve.
meanings.sent4: His addressability to the hidden compartment was like a secret agent uncovering classified information.
meanings.sent5: The addressability of the telescope allowed us to see distant planets with clarity.
